verses.text: The word of the \sc Lord\sc* that came to Jeremiah concerning the dearth.
Judah mourneth, and the gates thereof languish; They are black unto the ground; And the cry of Jerusalem is gone up.

And their nobles have sent their little ones to the waters: They came to the pits, \add and\add* found no water; They returned \add with\add* their vessels empty; They were ashamed and confounded, and covered their heads.
Because the ground is chapt, For there was no rain in the earth, The plowmen were ashamed, they covered their heads.
Yea, the hind also calved in the field, and forsook \add it\add*, Because there was no grass.
And the wild asses did stand in the high places, They snuffed up the wind like dragons; Their eyes did fail, because \add there was\add* no grass.
O \sc Lord\sc*, though our iniquities testify against us, do thou \add it\add* for thy name’s sake: for our backslidings are many; we have sinned against thee.
O the hope of Israel, the saviour thereof in time of trouble, why shouldest thou be as a stranger in the land, and as a wayfaring man \add that\add* turneth aside to tarry for a night?
Why shouldest thou be as a man astonied, as a mighty \add man that\add* cannot save? yet thou, O \sc Lord\sc*, \add art\add* in the midst of us, and we are called by thy name; leave us not.

Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* unto this people, Thus have they loved to wander, they have not refrained their feet, therefore the \sc Lord\sc* doth not accept them; he will now remember their iniquity, and visit their sins.
Then said the \sc Lord\sc* unto me, Pray not for this people for \add their\add* good.
When they fast, I will not hear their cry; and when they offer burnt offering and an oblation, I will not accept them: but I will consume them by the sword, and by the famine, and by the pestilence.
Then said I, Ah Lord \sc God\sc*! behold, the prophets say unto them, Ye shall not see the sword, neither shall ye have famine; but I will give you assured peace in this place.

Then the \sc Lord\sc* said unto me, The prophets prophesy lies in my name: I sent them not, neither have I commanded them, neither spake unto them: they prophesy unto you a false vision and divination, and a thing of nought, and the deceit of their heart.

Therefore thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* concerning the prophets that prophesy in my name, and I sent them not, yet they say, Sword and famine shall not be in this land; By sword and famine shall those prophets be consumed.

And the people to whom they prophesy shall be cast out in the streets of Jerusalem because of the famine and the sword; and they \add shall\add* have none to bury them, them, their wives, nor their sons, nor their daughters: for I will pour their wickedness upon them.

Therefore thou shalt say this word unto them; Let mine eyes run down \add with\add* tears night and day, and let them not cease: For the virgin daughter of my people is broken \add with\add* a great breach, \add with\add* a very grievous blow.

If I go forth \add into\add* the field, then behold the slain with the sword: And if I enter \add into\add* the city, then behold them that are sick with famine: Yea, both the prophet and the priest go about into a land that they know not.

Hast thou utterly rejected Judah? hath thy soul lothed Zion? Why hast thou smitten us, and \add there is\add* no healing for us? \add We\add* looked for peace, and \add there is\add* no good; And for the time of healing, and behold trouble.
We acknowledge, O \sc Lord\sc*, our wickedness, \add and\add* the iniquity of our fathers: For we have sinned against thee.
Do not abhor \add us\add*, for thy name’s sake, Do not disgrace the throne of thy glory: Remember, break not thy covenant with us.

Are there \add any\add* among the vanities of the Gentiles that can cause rain? Or can the heavens give showers? \add Art\add* not thou he, O \sc Lord\sc* our God? therefore we will wait upon thee: For thou hast made all these \add things\add*.
